Reviews.Title: “7 star service hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaMartins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is WOW! The rooms are so big and so poshy, elegant and fashionable. Upon arrival we were given a free room upgrade + free wifi in the room too. The bathroom is very elegant too. We requested to stay on a top floor to have views of the city. Upon arrival and once checked into our room, we received a complimentary welcome fruit platter. Every day, they leave a complimentary big bottle of water in the room. The spa is so beautiful!! I have never seen such a big jacuzzi with comfortable seatings in it. The breakfast is amazing too but costs around EUR 40 per person. The hotel is very centrally located with many restaurants and shops on the same street. Just 30 seconds away, there's a train station. The staff at the help desk are very very helpful. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel apart from 1 bar which is smoking. The only drawback we had was that one evening, there was a red carpet event and we went to this bar to have a smoke and they told us that the bar is out of reach for that evening. So we had to literally go out of the hotel to smoke which was quite uncomfortable since there were a lot of cameras and elegantly dressed people. However, all in all i recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great design place”
Reviews.Author: Ines L
Reviews.Content: I had an executive conference in this hotel and was very well treated every step of the way. To me it is the perfect combination of Turkish hospitality, US service orientation and German quality and sincerity (the GM is a German). It is in perfect location for business trips, not so much for sightseeing. Can highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Davey_Shir
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul and loved staying in this hotel! The location is slightly far from the main tourist attractions in Sultanahmet, but not too bad as the hotel is right beside the Levent train station (train, funicular, and tram will get you there in about 30 mins). and the area near the hotel has a number of good restaurants. The highlight of our stay here was the help we received from the concierge. Those 2 gentlemen helped us with dinner recommendations and bookings, as well as ideas for our itinerary and suggestions on places to visit. They definitely went above and beyond anything we expected and made our stay in the city extremely smooth and enjoyable. The rooms have very modern amenities and we felt very comfortable inside the room. Will definitely stay here again next time I visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: San F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for relaxation, the spa is fantastic, make sure to set a side time for it. The breakfast is incritable, the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is far from Istanbul attractions I recommend using the Metro to get to Taksim square, the metro is clean and fast. Try to avoid taxis as much as you can the traffic is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Super Modern, A bit far from tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: Christina123_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel echos L.A. or NYC glam. It's extremely minimalist and state-of-the art. There are buttons in the room to open the shades! Amazing. The spa is to die for! The pool/spa area holds a sauna, steamroom, and SNOW room. It's a showstopper! The location is a bit far from tourist sites. One must take two trains and a tram to get to the old city. The Levent neighborhood (where the hotel is located) only offers two huge malls and numerous restaurants. You do get a feel for the "business" side of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: margherita010
Reviews.Content: I arrived and I had a room upgrade, helpful staff, the room was amazing, big, quiet, comfortable and spacious. The bed was soo comfortable that I did not want to wake up in the morning. I had a business dinner at the Cipriani restaurant inside of the hotel, the food was well presented, delicious and the dessert unforgettable. Service was very kind and attentive. I stayed only a couple of days but we had a great support in arranging a video conference and everything was smooth. I used their pick up service from and to the airport...no delays, superb service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - I would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: australianlawyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was lovely to be in, quiet, and the location good for my business meetings Wifi was included in the room rate and worked well, if rather slow (too slow for large pdf files).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, trendy hotel with fantastic restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: galinat
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel room and breakfast room we've stayed. Super helpful staff from the very beginning - concierge Cenk and reservations Nil were great in correspondence. Cipriany restaurant is super- food, service and ambiance. ESPA SPA even situated underground is very professionally designed and run. Try the hamam treatment with Wayan! Even the location is not so great, the hotel itself compensates - you could spend the whole day not going out- the gym, the SPA , the rooms and the restaurant are really fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel Ever, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaGypsy
Reviews.Content: Building: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in in my life. The room design was fantastic; the white marble bathroom was a work of art. Everything was white glove, modern luxury. The in room toiletries were even fantastic (rarely a fan of these). I actually spent a day mostly in the hotel enjoying the gym, spa, and roomâ€”something I have never sacrificed a day of travel to before. Spa/Gym: The workout/ spa area is 3 levels with sauna, steam room, and snow room, a beautiful (but smaller) pool and hot tub. Regardless of what you have planned, it's worth getting up early for a morning workout and steam or maybe ducking in early for an afternoon or evening swim. Staff: Phenomenal, friendly yet unobtrusive. Concierges knowledgeable, helpful, extremely skilled. Everyone here goes out of their way for their guests. Only downsides: Hotel is so nice that you don't want to leave and explore. Also, the neighborhood is kind of Southern California suburban and it doesn't have the hustle and bustle of older parts of the city. It's not as walkable although you can walk to the metro and there is a small neighborhood adjacent to the hotel with a limited amount of shops and cafes. Hotel staff is very good at getting you a cab promptly if that's your thing and you can be in other parts of the city quickly. Also, metro is modern, clean, fairly easy to navigate and close by.

Reviews.Title: “Style, no substance”
Reviews.Author: oruanaidh
Reviews.Content: Aww, I was hoping to write a glowing review of this hotel. I did extensive research before booking and this place seemed to tick all the boxes. Rooms are nice, but on a quiet week I was stuck in a room overlooking wasteland. Ask for a city facing room. International channels on the tv are very limited. Service was nice on checkin, but a bit over bearing. I like to pull my own luggage, but bellhop wouldn't hear of it, to the point of rudeness. Service in the bar was shocking. 3 customers, 3 members of staff, 10 minutes waiting to pay my tab. Staff seemed to be hiding/smoking in a side room. Complained at time and on checkout, no reaction. Why ask, if you don't care. Location is poor, way outside the main city. Istanbul is such a wonderful place, I made a mistake staying here, there's better hotels closer to main attractions. Oh, gym was very good, I liked that.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dzlee02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Christmas season and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The property itself is lovely and extremely well-maintained and the staff is extremely knowledgeable and attentive. It was our first time in Istanbul and we found the gentleman at the concierge to be absolutely invaluable - every time, his recommendations for dinner, activities, city highlights, etc. were spot-on. The location of the hotel is also decent. It may be a bit far out, but it is right next to the metro station called Levant and it becomes a straight shot to Taksim. Getting to the old city requires a simple transfer. As a final comment, I must mention the phenomenal customer service. We tried their hamam spa experience and the hotel went out of their way to accommodate us. When we had a slight complaint about the length of time of the actual spa services, the hotel went far and beyond our expectations in terms of the resolution. I would recommend this hotel with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury - in a former bank!”
Reviews.Author: Greg-of-Arabia
Reviews.Content: The conversion of this building from a bank to a luxury hotel (actually part of the Marriott family of hotels - so use / earn points!) has been very cleverly thought through. The spa and pool, located well below ground level, are truly excellent (although the water temperature was definitely too cold for me!) and the bedrooms offer superb bathroom facilities with rain showers, 'river' bath taps and the beds are very comfortable. The TVs are a bit too clever for my liking, but they look great! ;) The hotel is a bit far from the historical part of the city, but being right next to a metro station makes it convenient if you're there for business (although do avoid the metro when Galatasaray football club are playing!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, extremely comfortable, nice spa, great service”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: I honestly hadn't slept well in a long, long time (not even at home) until I stayed at Edition in Istanbul. With the exception of one night (when there was a party in the ballroom), it was extremely quiet. When I called reception to inquire about the noise, they immediately offered to relocate me to another room where I wouldn't hear any noise. I was too tired to move, but the party ended within an hour and a half, so I was okay with that. I then settled into dreamland and, again, slept like a baby. As for the spa, I only used the pool, but it was quite nice for swimming laps. Also, the spa and hotel room had excellent rain shower heads. The hotel is nicely designed with a contemporary flair, the rooms are a nice size and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed my stay there. As for location, it worked for me. It's not in a tourist location, but if you want to get to the tourist areas, the metro is across the street and taxis are easily accessible directly around the corner from the hotel. As for shopping, there are two malls within walking distance of the hotel. I found Istanbul to be a wonderful place filled with friendly people and, of course, a very comfortable and enjoyable hotel experience at the Edition. The only thing you may want to consider, when returning to the airport, is walking around the corner from the hotel to the taxi stand. By doing so, you can negotiate your own rate to the airport. When I had someone at the hotel order a taxi, I ended up paying about 50% more to return to Ataturk than it cost me to get to the hotel (same traffic conditions and same taxi company).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Renu B
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Istanbul, but my luggage did not arrive. The staff at the hotel went way above and beyond to make sure my stay was comfortable. They gave me some toiletries, but the kicker for me was when I said the only thing I need is a contact lense case and solution, otherwise I won't be able to see. At 10pm while I was having dinner, the concierge came to the restaurant and gave me what I needed. He's sourced out a pharmacy across the city that was open that late!!! Not only that, the concierge checked with the airline 5 times a day to stay on top of the status of my bags ... I didn't have to waste a single minute of my trip on the phone trying to find my bags. They kept me informed throughout my stay. It took 2.5 days for my bags to arrive but thanks to the staff at The Edition, I didn't worry at all. I really cannot describe the level of customer service in words -- you have to visit to experience it. In my opinion, this is the best hotel experience I've ever had. Thank you, Istanbul Edition!

Reviews.Title: “More than we imagined possible.”
Reviews.Author: traweek
Reviews.Content: My huisband and I have traveled the world, staying in some of the best hotels from Thailand to Hong Kong to Rome, and without a doubt the Editionâ€™s staff was the best trained, most sincerely friendly and more helpful that any other hotel weâ€™ve experienced. As platinum Marriott members, we can honestly say this Marriott brand hotel is the best that weâ€™ve had the pleasure of staying in. While the location is definately city central for business, Yigit, the concierge, carefully supplied directions and fabulous suggestions for our week's stay. The furnishings are top of the line, the breakfast over the top and the spa experience was heaven. This stay was made all the more personal by my husbandâ€™s birthday. The entire staff signed a homemade card, and the wonderful Guest Services person, Ilksen, had the room filled with balloons and a devine chocolate cake delivered. I have to say, the Edition Hotel and staff made coming to Istanbul feel like coming home!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Location is not an issue because metro nearby”
Reviews.Author: Proxyj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice rooms. Excellent service. Quiet area. Fantastic experience

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon this past July and wholeheartedly recommend the hotel! Our entire experience was fantastic. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful, the rooms were beautifully appointed, the bathrooms spacious, great pool & spa. Unfortunately I got sick the morning of our departure to Capadoccia but the staff at the front desk was phenominal. They made a doctor appointment for me in Capadoccia and when we arrived at our next hotel they had faxed a get well soon card that was signed by over 40 staff members! We were extremely touched!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emoney1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our first trip to Istanbul this summer. The rooms are great and the service even greater! Everyone on the staff was extremely attentive and helpful. It's in the newer section of Istanbul and takes a metro ride to get to the old part of the city where most of the historical sites are, but well worth it. Be sure to do 3 things at this hotel. 1) Go get a treatment at the eSpa. It's an experience! 2) Talk to Cenk, the head concierge, to help you plan your eventful stay in Istanbul. He has excellent suggestions and is a wealth of information no matter if you want to experience the historical sites or take in the night life. 3) Eat at Cipriani's in the hotel lobby. Really delicious!! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new design experience”
Reviews.Author: Henrik J
Reviews.Content: Loved it - just want the Marriott group needed. A real lifestyle brand with extraordinary service. Unlike Ritz-Carlton and Marriott hotels. Knew my by name when I arrived and service was very personalized as you would expect in a hotel with 78 rooms. Absolutely loved it and will over time be known as THE place to stay in Istanbul. Spa is one of the best in the world. The intro rates is incredible value and there is a reason why 95% of all Tripadvisor reviews says the same thing!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel... but..”
Reviews.Author: weaselz99
Reviews.Content: Let me first state that this hotel is a very clean, upscale, nice place. I really don't think that is debatable. And if you are traveling for business it may be a perfect place, but I am guessing most people that read this aren't traveling for business primarily. The hotel is located in probably the most bland financial district around, you have a couple options to eat, but both are in malls, that are a short walk. To me a mall isn't the place you really want to eat when on vacation. Secondly, you know that feeling you get when you go through airport security? Well it's like that every time you go in and out of your hotel. As they have a TON of security around the place, and you put your items through an Xray machine and you go through a metal detector as you enter the property.. Nothing says welcome home quite like that! Now I do understand why they have this security, as this building was once a bank ( its got a definite bank feel throughout) and was Bombed several years back, it just isn't representative of the city/ country. Its an optimistic 30 mins from where the touristic sites are. We travelled for a fast trip and wanted to see all the defacto standard Istanbul items.. well they are at minimal of 30 mins away no matter the mode of transportation, and in a cab, its probably a bit more as traffic is horrendous at best. Yes there is a metro just on the next block, but if you don't have much time to learn it then its probably not your best bet, as its 7 interchanges before getting to the Blue Mosque / Hagia Sophia etc area. Another item, I don't want to feel like I am ranting.. ok maybe I am. But, we took a couple day trips (FULL day trips) to other sites of Cappadocia and Ephesus that just wore us out completely from 4am-11pm so when we got back to the hotel we were totally exhausted to put it mildly. We attempted to have a glass of wine when we got back from one of these excursions to "wine down" and as one could imagine we were not wearing our sunday best, nor looking like a million dollars either. Although we weren't looking trashy at all either, we were barely acknowledged in the semi full bar, as the after work posh crowd was given full attention. 2 glasses of house wine was about 60 bucks, which is fine, but give me a little attention, ask if we would like more, a snack something is all I ask. Like I said it is a very , new, clean, modern place, just not the place you want to setup command central for a vacation. Business.. maybe, depending on where you are doing business.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamipilar
Reviews.Content: everything from the moment you arrive until you leave the Edition is perfect. The service is genuinely hospitable, the room is impeccable, and the small details are wonderful! One of the best stays I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cublooded
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in the front door until the moment you depart, everyone at The Istanbul Edition goes out of their way to ensure that you have the absolute best experience at their hotel. In addition to a helpful, responsive and engaged staff, the facilities are outstanding. The rooms are spacious and the quality of everything in them is of the highest quality. The workout room and especially the pool, sauna, snow hut (!) and steam rooms are the perfect way to relax after a day exploring Istanbul. The spa is also fantastic. If you're in town on business and working in/near Levent, the location is great. If you're in town as a tourist, it's a bit off the beaten path and traffic can be terrible getting to the major attractions and the Old City. However, the Levent Metro stop is 50m outside the front door and it's an easy trip (2 changes, but easy ones and 30 mins) into the heart of Istanbul. I'd stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel: The Edition in Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel: The Edition in Istanbul, Turkey The location, service, art, design, and attention to detail of this hotel is amazingly wonderful and their Turkish spa is a dream! Convenient â€“ just steps from the metro. I canâ€™t wait to return to The Edition, my new favorite hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: barbexpat
Reviews.Content: We booked the Edition hotel because of the rave reviews on tripadviser. We found - Large modern rooms -with a comfortable sitting area to relax in Safe -mini bar- loads of storage space Buttons to press to close the curtains (fun ) A strange bathroom with glass walls ! OK - hotel not in the ideal location for visiting "old Istanbul " but there are plenty of taxis and the public transport system was really easy to use. An added bonus is that there are 2 large shopping Malls just a short walk from the hotel -with Marks and Spencers and Harvey Nicks ! -and loads of retaurants. It was my birthday whilst in Istanbul - our bed was covered with balloons and a yummy birthday cake and card were given to me by the hotel. That evening we had a table booked for dinner The doorman stood in the road and tried to wave down a taxi- there were none He phoned a taxi company -still no use It told us to wait -and vanished - came back with HIS OWN CAR ! and drove us to the restaurant Amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Odd..”
Reviews.Author: semush
Reviews.Content: Before I arrived at this hotel I didn't know it was converted from the HSBC building that was bombed in 2003. When I found out as we approached from the airport I had a memory trip as I have been to the building before the bombing and knew quite a few people who worked there at the time. The interior has changed profoundly into a luxury hotel. The reception, the rooms and the bathrooms were fitted with the latest technology luxury fittings. The lights, music, tv as well as the curtains can be controlled by the switch panel next to the bed. Everything was tastefully expensive. Even the room spray and the soap sets smelled wonderful. It is more of a business hotel more than touristic since it is situated at the banking district of Istanbul. It was very close to the main shopping centers in Istanbul, Kanyon and Istinye Park. It was perfect for us cause we went there for shopping for a long weekend. Also it is next to a main Metro station which might be a compromise for those who want to visit the city attractions. However it was one of the noisiest hotels I've ever stayed in. You could hear the next door neighbour's music and tv as if it was in our own room. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and understanding towards us so we did not leave the hotel with bad feelings. However the management has to find an urgent solution to their insulation problem. Otherwise no one would be too happy to pay the price and have a bad night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “"Modern, funky and SPACIOUS"”
Reviews.Author: ash318
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011, for 3 nights. We opted for the super spacious LOFT rooms. They were super large, moden and clean looking, stark and pristine. Loved the whole feel of the hotel, the interiors ( from the outside, the hotel looks like not much), but on the inside, its a complete surprise. The "Dining room" that was a place where you can relax, watch tv, nibble on some food and just a place to relax instead of going to the bar or to your room, is just fantastic. The staff missed to mention this added feature of the hotel, but probably because it had just opened. The Gold Bar- was great- nice comfy outdoor seating with heaters and great yummy cocktails. The millionares club-lets just say - it felt like you had to be a model , or European to be in there! The Harry Cipriani had poor service, 1 high chair in the entire restaurant, which was strange and overall a poor unexpected service experience. I am sure it will be better with time as they iron the kinks out, but I will be back. It was a nice change to be away from the traffic of Taksim!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay - outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: colleen2227
Reviews.Content: My husband and I kicked off our 2 week honeymoon at the Edition and absolutely loved it. The room was spacious, modern and cleanly, with a comfortable bed and fabulous bathroom. The gym, bar and spa facilities were also top notch. Great breakfast too! Although this property is a bit far from old town, its simple to navigate the public transportation (right outside the front door) to get anywhere you need to go. The biggest kudos we want to give the Edition however is the service. We were greeted upon arrival by the manager on duty, and all staff we encountered throughout our stay were so polite and helpful. We truly felt like VIPS, and they went out of their way to ensure our honeymoon was enjoyable. I am not sure if Cenk is still there, but he was FABULOUS as a concierge. He helped me so much before our arrival with tips, maps, restaurant recommendations, and sat with us upon while in Istanbul to go over our stay in detail and offer tips, etc. He offered a guide to us at no cost (which i forgot to take him up on prior to arriving), so instead he provided a complimentary luxury transfer back to the airport upon departure. He was amazing. Overall, excellent stay with excellent staff - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: RuinOfTheState
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at various true 5 star places like the fabulous range of Morgans Hotels and Christina Ong's wonderful Como Shambala resorts, the Edition hotel was a complete let down. True 5 star places offer style and substance...the Edition is attempting style but provides no substance. 1. I requested a loft room with a terrace on a high floor - I arrived to find that my room was on the second floor beside a 4 lane carriage way. It was deafening an not possible to sit out there for more than 5 minutes. Also the terrace was shared with the room next door. I complained and was shown another room with a much better terrace, but the room was tiny. 2. The restaurant attached to the hotel is Le Caprice, all meals / rooms service were prepared by Caprice and the price of the food reflected this. However, the room service breakfasts were terrible. The order arrived either completely wrong or with missing items 4 mornings out of four. The breakfast was also of poor quality and cooked badly. 3. I decided to use the Rain Shower in the bathroom only to find that I had flooded the entire bathroom and part of the hotel room. I contacted the manager who advised that this was a known problem - there was a design flaw which meant the water did not drain away. 4. The bedside light wouldn't go off, it took some time for me to convince the hotel staff that I couldn't wait until tomorrow to have it fixed and that in order for me sleep someone needed to come and fix it now. In the end they send someone to turn part of the electricity off in the room. 5. Maid service was erratic, we had turndown twice out of 4 nights After my stay I contacted the hotel again about the problems I encountered. They apologised and said that the breakfast had been outsourced due to problems in the Caprice kitchen and that the design faults with rooms were being rectified. they did offer me a free upgrade if I come back and stay with them again, but I won't be taking them up on their offer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Remarkable Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: rbg3
Reviews.Content: We choose the Edition over The Ritz using Marriott Points and couldn't have been happier. The rooms are among the nicest we'd ever stayed in and the spa and heath club ended up being daily stops. The real standout here though was the hotel staff. Absolutely everyone from the concierge to the security agents bent over backward to ensure we had directions, reservations, transportation and tips on what to do and how to get everywhere in the city - going as far as suggesting if we felt a cab driver was overcharging us to call them immediately and they would straighten it out. We can't say enough about how helpful they were during our stay in Istanbul, literally helping make our vacation. The location of the hotel isn't ideal for vacationers, but it is directly upstairs from the metro, which is particularly easy to use (and if you have any questions on how to get anywhere, the front desk has help cards with directions you can take). Location however should not be a deterrent from staying here as it was well worth the 10 minute trips into and out of Taksim and the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, experienced staff”
Reviews.Author: kadir_ist
Reviews.Content: Thanks to www.birdolutatil.com travel agency, we have made a perfect staying.... The hotel price is above the aveage, but the price is worth it....good location near metro station...

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel & Extraordinary staff”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler65
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Istanbul Edition. In all our travels, we have never, ever been recieved with such a warm and sincere welcome as we experienced from the hotel's staff. I had emailed the concierge Yigit Bozkurt prior to our arrival and he provided a wealth of information that was most helpful. Upon arrival the entire staff were very attentive to making certain that we had a wonderful experience in their great city. Kudos to the Receptionists, Cenk the head concierge, Cenk the bellman, and Erme & Murat in the Gold Bar, for making our stay so pleasurable! This hotel is just exquisitely designed and very chic, yet warm and a peaceful. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed with controls for all the lights and draperies by the bedside. Although not located in the 'tourist' area, travel to the major sights was extremely easy via the Metro station which was just steps away. We particularly enjoyed not being in the old city because we could truly experience today's Istanbul and it's people.

Reviews.Title: “i wish we didn't go!”
Reviews.Author: leesumin
Reviews.Content: I & my friend went to this hotel.we stayed 4days.This hotel is new but very remote all of historical places.We always had to walk a lot.I think you can find better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TW41
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at little out of the main area so we chose the Hotel Edition in Levent. Wow, what a terrific decision, from it's wonderfully warm staff to it's sleek and stylish rooms we had the most wonderful time in Istanbul. Only steps to the metro stop at Levent it allowed us to get around the city with comfort and ease. The concierge booked us for dinner at the Sunset Grill (not to be missed with its commanding views of the Bosphorus and tree lined hills) on our first night and it truly set the tone for a great stay. Plus the beds are the most comfortable on the face of the planet - guaranteed! Have fun you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “A Personalized Oriental Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBAthens
Reviews.Content: The Edition Istanbul hotel was an exceptional hotel in all aspects. In addition to the excellent facilities, beautifully designed spaces and rooms, where every details of the decor has been carefully chosen,the overriding attribute of this hotel is its staff. From the greeting of staff at the entrance, the reception, to the management, the guest feels genuinely welcome. The hotel's facilities including pool and the spa services are of the highest standard, and staff are very professional and discreet. The concierge services of the Istanbul Edition were exceptional as Cenk and his associate provided a very personalized service, based on our needs and interests both cultural and culinary, making our stay in Istanbul unique.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING & FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Nithiij
Reviews.Content: as we approached the building the exterior got us a bit worried but once we stepped inside it was a completely different story. I checked out today the 17th of July after 4 nights in room 504 and i was truly sad to say goodbye to what was the nicest, kindest, warmest and most hospitable team I have had the pleasure to be served by. I am someone who frequents the Four seasons, The Chedi and other GHM properties but never before have I been so impressed by a small boutique city hotel- its is simply Exceptional. The rooms are large and fabulously designed with an impeccable attention to detail, the bed feels like a Duxiana or a Hastens and is just WOW !. The rooms are truly delightful and this level of excellence is carried forward into the incredible spa and gym and the wonderful silver tiled pool. The only negative i would bother to comment on is the breakfast which is far below the standard expected- it was a poor spread and rather amateurishly managed and certainly not in keeping with the standard of the property. Cenk the Concierge introduced us to Istanbul in a manner no other could , out every meal, our day schedule was all so superbly recommended that we could not thank him enough. Any concierge could recommend the fancy mainstream places but Cenk found us well priced super restaurants and great venues to ensure we experienced the city the best possible way we could - I urge any reader to simply allow him to plan your every day and trust in his judgegement. I can go on but in conclusion i and my family Loved our stay here, we would not stay anywhere else- the location is fantastic and so so central and convenient .. I would award this Hotel 9 of 10 (the negative 1 mark is only for the poor breakfast). We will be back- despite this being a business hotel and we being a family of 4 with 2 noisy children the staff made us feel so at home that we felt bad saying goodbye. This hotel deserves an award for excellence in hospitality- Congratulations to the team at THE EDITION Istanbul. !

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience of my life... seriously!”
Reviews.Author: msayour
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is amazing, esthetically unbelievable... and every possible thing you could want is there- total luxury. The highlight for me was definitely the staff.. SO kind, tremendously helpful and wonderful all around.. I will be back to stay again, and would highly recommend a stay here to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mariangela18
Reviews.Content: If you see the hotel from the outside you could not guess what you would find inside. Extremely kind staff and awesome environment. The room was perfect. It is sometimes difficult to choose between going out or staying in the spa area which is so nice! The concierge service is absolutely incredible. They just know exactly what to suggest. You can always trust them. Their recommendations were always perfect. I specifically want to thank Cenk (who we consulted the most) who helped us to book activities and arranged transportation and plans. If I go to Istanbul again I wouldn't doubt about staying there!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: serial2urist
Reviews.Content: where do I start? the outside building is a bit ugly but no way not to love the interior grounds of the hotel..big wow factor but at the same time total relaxation for the eye! we loved everything, the beautiful and comfortable rooms, the extraordinary shower, the nice - and empty?- bar , wonderful food with huge portions ..and the spa!! one of the best I have ever seen . breakfast is good, but could have used more variety .the best part is the service ,we had dinner one night at a fast food close to the hotel and had communication problems since we don't speak turkish. The doorman of the EDITION, who had his day off, happened to be at the place too and he helped us in placing our order. This was not his job since he wasn't working and we were some how distant of the hotel. We were very impressed and wish to thank him. Also, we forgot an old family watch that has great sentimental and material value . We called the hotel and were informed that the house keeping manager, Dogan, had found it. The guest relation manager, Aekin, was also very helpful. They sent our watch by courier to the Kempinski and it arrived two days later. We are really grateful that they found our watch, since we are aware that it was possible for staff not to ''see''. This is a great staff. The only flaw of this hotel is that it is somehow far from the main attractions of the city, being located more on a business area but it is close to metro so no problem. The area has many malls though. Overall, I recommend this hotel for its design and for its staff.

Reviews.Title: “ThatÂ´s what IÂ´m talking about...”
Reviews.Author: Ziry
Reviews.Content: Now, thatÂ´s a trendy boutique hotel. Impecable in every aspect. Wonderful room and the most impressive service. Amazing spa (believe it, thereÂ´s a snow sauna!) Only possible problem: Location (far from the main attractions, but in the new financial area, great mall close by).

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcfx1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Edition for a 2-night because we had Marriott points -- but this is not your typical Marriott. It's more like a 'W' but even better. Our room was beautiful, spacious and luxurious. The gym and pool are outstanding. And our concierge, Cenk, was a font of information and enthusiasm. His recommendations were outstanding and original in terms of restaurants and places to see, and general knowledge about how to get around the city, what to see and what (and who) to avoid. The hotel is close to the Taksim metro station -- a 20-30 minute ride on various public transportation to the Old City. But I would rather stay in this part of Istanbul than be on top of the main tourist area. I don't see this as a great place for families with young kids, but if you are travelling on business alone or as a couple, it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArthurAdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location that is close to everything via taxi or public transportation and the staff was the best we have dealt with in a long time at any hotel. The concierge gave us a great game plan to see the city and helped with every need...big and small. We have also stayed at the Waikiki Edition and enjoyed it late last year. The downstairs lounge was nice and relaxing and the bartenders and waiters were also very pleasurable and attentive...even designed us our own drink. We will surely be back! Also...there was great security at the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic visit to a beautiful city with gracious people and staff at the EDITION.”
Reviews.Author: NHeera
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul was made even more special with our stay at the EDITION. We were traveling with teenage twins and what started off as a not so pleasant experience (With missing bags arriving two days late) to be salvaged by the warm and friendly staff at this new hotel. Especially the graciousness and kindness of Ekin & Ilksen. Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable for European standards. The spa and pool facilities were excellent and the location of this hotel makes travel to the old city and all the historical sights very convenient. The concierge as well as the front office staff are extremely helpful with recommendations for restaurants and other local destinations. Traditional Turkish breakfast and tea were our favorites. A memorable vacation to a beautiful city and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've Stayed at in Years”
Reviews.Author: jaipurCt
Reviews.Content: We're returning to New York after a wonderful trip to Istanbul and I never write reviews but this hotel was so amazing I just have to let others know about it. It just opened 3 weeks ago and everything about it is what you would want in a luxury hotel. The pool, spa and excercise area are really spectacular. The concierge, Cenk, gave us fabulous advice - planning our itinerary, helping us navigate and choose the best options and steered us to some of the best restaurants we've eaten at anywhere. If you're traveling to Istanbul I recommend that you consider the Edition.

HotelInfo.Name: The Istanbul EDITION
HotelInfo.Address: Buyukdere Caddesi No: 136 | Levent, Istanbul 34330, Turkey
